intro: Fimbristylis biumbellulata, commonly known as the two-awned sedge, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or seasonally wet habitats, such as marshes and swampy areas. Its inflorescence consists of a dense spike of tiny, three-ranked flowers, with bracts that have awns at the base. Fimbristylis biumbellulata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the biodiversity of wetland ecosystems.
